examples: They have one **son** and two daughters.
My **son** is five years old.

words.definition: A short poem or piece of music intended to be sung.
words.notes: Used when talking about music.
examples: I love that new **song**.
The children were singing a happy **song**.

words.translation: birazdan, kısa süre içinde, az sonra
words.definition: In a short time from now.
words.notes: Used to describe an event happening quickly or in the near future.
examples: I will see you **soon**.
Dinner will be ready **soon**.

words.definition: Feeling distress, especially regret or pity; used to express apology or regret.
words.notes: Used in the phrase **I am sorry**.
examples: I am **sorry** I was late.
I feel **sorry** for the poor dog.

words.definition: Vibrations that travel through the air or another medium and can be heard when they reach a person's or animal's ear.
words.notes: Can be a **noun** (**ses**) or a **verb** (**gelmek/tınlamak**).
examples: I heard a strange **sound**.
That **sounds** like a good idea.

words.definition: A liquid food made by boiling meat, fish, or vegetables in stock or water.
words.notes: A common first course or light meal.
examples: I like tomato **soup**.
The **soup** is too hot to eat.

words.definition: The direction toward the point of the horizon where the sun is at its furthest from the equator.
words.notes: One of the four main compass directions. The opposite is **north**.
examples: We drove **south** towards the coast.
The window faces **south**.

words.definition: A continuous area or expanse which is free, available, or unoccupied; the universe beyond the earth's atmosphere.
words.notes: Can refer to a physical area or outer space (uzay).
examples: There is enough **space** for a table.
I love learning about **space**.

words.definition: To say something in order to express one's thoughts, feelings, or intentions.
words.notes: **Irregular verb**: speak - spoke - spoken. Used for talking and language ability.
examples: Can you **speak** English?
I need to **speak** to the manager.

words.definition: Better, greater, or otherwise different from what is usual.
words.notes: The opposite is **ordinary** or **common**.
examples: Today is a **special** day.
The cafe has a **special** menu for lunch.

words.definition: To write or name the letters that form (all or part of a word).
words.notes: The verb form is **hecelemek**. The noun is **spelling**.
examples: Can you **spell** your name for me?
How do you **spell** 'restaurant'?

words.definition: The way in which a word is spelled.
words.notes: The noun form of **spell**.
examples: The word is difficult, I checked the **spelling**.
Your **spelling** on the test was perfect.

words.definition: To give money to pay for goods or services; to devote or use up (time or energy).
words.notes: **Irregular verb**: spend - spent - spent. Used for money and time.
examples: I like to **spend** time with my family.
How much money did you **spend** on your holiday?

words.definition: An activity involving physical exertion and skill in which an individual or team competes against another or others for entertainment.
words.notes: Used when talking about physical activities.
examples: My favorite **sport** is basketball.
Do you play any **sports**?

words.definition: The season after winter and before summer, in which vegetation begins to appear.
words.notes: A season of the year. Often used with **in** (e.g., in spring).
examples: The flowers grow in the **spring**.
**Spring** is my favorite season.

words.definition: To have or maintain an upright position, supported by one's feet.
words.notes: **Irregular verb**: stand - stood - stood. Used in the phrase **stand up**.
examples: Please **stand** up when the teacher enters.
I cannot **stand** for a long time.

words.definition: A large, gaseous body that shines by its own light in the night sky; a celebrated performer in entertainment.
words.notes: Can be an astronomical object or a famous person (ünlü).
examples: I saw a bright **star** in the sky.
She is a big movie **star**.

words.definition: To begin or come into being; to cause or enable (a course of action, a journey, or an enterprise) to begin.
words.notes: Can be a **verb** or a **noun** (**başlangıç**). The opposite is **finish** or **end**.
examples: The class **starts** at nine o'clock.
Where do we **start** the project?
The **start** of the race was delayed.

words.definition: A clear expression of something in speech or writing.
words.notes: The noun form of the verb **state**.
examples: The witness gave a written **statement** to the police.
That is a strong political **statement**.

words.definition: A regular stopping place on a public transportation route, especially one with a platform and building.
words.notes: Used for train, bus, or metro stops.
examples: I met him at the train **station**.
The bus **station** is downtown.

words.definition: To remain in the same place; to live somewhere temporarily.
words.notes: Used when referring to remaining in one spot or lodging somewhere.
examples: I will **stay** at home tonight.
We **stayed** in a hotel for three days.

words.definition: Continuing up to the present time; until now; without moving.
words.notes: Most commonly used as an **adverb** (**hala**).
examples: It is **still** raining outside.
Are you **still** working on that project?
Stand **still** for a moment.

words.definition: To bring or come to an end; to cease from movement or operation.
words.notes: Can be a **verb** or a **noun** (**durma**). The opposite is **start** or **continue**.
examples: Please **stop** talking now.
The bus **stops** here.
The rain **stopped**.

words.definition: An account of imaginary or real people and events told for entertainment.
words.notes: Used when talking about literature, films, or personal anecdotes.
examples: Tell me a bedtime **story**.
That is an amazing true **story**.

words.definition: A public road in a city or town, typically with houses and buildings on one or both sides.
words.notes: Used when giving directions or referring to location.
examples: My house is on a busy **street**.
Walk down the **street** to the corner.

words.definition: Having the power to move heavy weights or perform other physically demanding tasks.
words.notes: The opposite is **weak**.
examples: He is very **strong**, he can lift heavy boxes.
I drink **strong** coffee.

words.definition: A person who is studying at a school or college.
words.notes: Used when talking about people in education.
examples: I am a university **student**.
The **students** are studying for an exam.

words.definition: To devote time and attention to acquiring knowledge on (an academic subject), especially by means of books.
words.notes: Can be a **verb** (**çalışmak**) or a **noun** (**çalışma**).
examples: I need to **study** for the test.
I spent all night on my **study** of history.

words.definition: A distinct conventional or characteristic manner of expression, design, or action.
words.notes: Used when talking about appearance or method.
examples: I like her sense of **style**.
This painting is in a modern **style**.

words.definition: An area of knowledge that is studied in school or college; a person or thing that is being discussed, described, or dealt with.
words.notes: Can refer to a school class (**ders**) or the topic of conversation (**konu**).
examples: My favorite **subject** is history.
What is the **subject** of this article?

words.definition: The accomplishment of an aim or purpose.
words.notes: The opposite is **failure**. The adjective is **successful**.
examples: I wish you **success** in your new job.
The event was a great **success**.

words.definition: A sweet crystalline substance obtained from various plants, especially sugar cane and sugar beet, used as a sweetener.
words.notes: Generally an **uncountable** noun.
examples: Do you want **sugar** in your coffee?
Too much **sugar** is bad for your health.

words.definition: The warmest season of the year, falling between spring and autumn.
words.notes: A season of the year. Often used with **in** (e.g., in summer).
examples: I love the hot weather in **summer**.
We go to the beach every **summer**.

words.definition: The star around which the earth orbits, providing heat and light.
words.notes: Often used with **the** (the sun).
examples: The **sun** is shining brightly today.
Don't look directly at the **sun**.

words.definition: The day of the week after Saturday and before Monday, observed as a day of rest and worship.
words.notes: The second day of the weekend.
examples: I like to relax on **Sunday**.
We usually eat dinner together every **Sunday**.

words.definition: A large self-service store selling foods and domestic goods.
words.notes: A place for buying groceries and household items.
examples: I need to go to the **supermarket** to buy milk.
The nearest **supermarket** is closed today.

words.definition: Completely confident that one is right; certain.
words.notes: Used to express confidence (**emin**) or agreement (**elbette**).
examples: Are you **sure** about that?
**Sure**, I can help you.
I am **sure** I locked the door.

words.definition: A knitted garment worn on the upper body for warmth.
words.notes: A piece of warm clothing. Also called a 'jumper' (UK).
examples: It's cold, put on a **sweater**.
I love my new wool **sweater**.

words.definition: To propel the body through water by means of the limbs.
words.notes: **Irregular verb**: swim - swam - swum. The activity is **swimming**.
examples: Can you **swim**?
I love to **swim** in the sea.

words.definition: The sport or activity of propelling oneself through water.
words.notes: The activity itself (gerund).
examples: I go **swimming** three times a week.
**Swimming** is good exercise.

words.definition: A piece of furniture with a flat top and one or more legs, providing a level surface for eating, writing, or working.
words.notes: A common piece of furniture.
examples: Put your books on the **table**.
We had dinner at a round **table**.

words.definition: To reach for and hold (something); to carry or transport.
words.notes: A very common verb with many meanings. **Irregular**: take - took - taken.
examples: Please **take** a seat.
I **take** the bus to work.
Can you **take** a photo of me?

words.definition: To speak in order to express information or ideas; a conversation or discussion.
words.notes: Can be a **verb** (**konuşmak**) or a **noun** (**sohbet**).
examples: Can we **talk** for a moment?
I had a long **talk** with my boss.

words.definition: Having a great or considerable extent upwards; higher than average.
words.notes: Used for the height of people and buildings. The opposite is **short**.
examples: He is very **tall**.
That is a **tall** building.

words.definition: A car licensed to transport passengers in return for payment of a fare.
words.notes: Used in the phrase **take a taxi** or **go by taxi**.
examples: Let's take a **taxi** to the airport.
The **taxi** driver was friendly.

words.definition: A hot drink made by infusing dried, crushed leaves of the tea plant in boiling water.
words.notes: A common beverage. Generally an **uncountable** noun.
examples: Would you like a cup of **tea**?
I prefer green **tea**.

words.definition: To impart knowledge of or skill in (something); to give instruction to (someone).
words.notes: **Irregular verb**: teach - taught - taught. The person who teaches is a **teacher**.
examples: She **teaches** English at a high school.
He **taught** me how to swim.

words.definition: A person who teaches, especially in a school.
words.notes: The person who performs the action of **teach**.
examples: My **teacher** is very kind.
She works as a math **teacher**.

words.definition: A group of people working together cooperatively or united as players in a game.
words.notes: Used in sports or work contexts.
examples: Our football **team** won the match.
We work as a **team** on this project.

words.translation: on üç ile on dokuz yaşlar arasındaki kimse, delikanlı, yeniyetme
words.definition: A person aged between 13 and 19 years.
words.notes: Used for young people in this specific age range.
examples: My brother is a **teenager**.
The show is popular with **teenagers**.

words.definition: A system for transmitting voices over a distance; the device itself.
words.notes: Often shortened to **phone**.
examples: I need to answer the **telephone**.
What is your **telephone** number?

words.definition: A system for transmitting visual images and sound; the device used to receive broadcast signals and show them.
words.notes: Often shortened to **TV**.
examples: I like to watch **television** in the evening.
Turn off the **television** when you leave.

words.definition: To communicate information, a story, or a command to someone.
words.notes: **Irregular verb**: tell - told - told. Used to convey information to someone.
examples: Can you **tell** me the time?
He **told** a funny story.

words.definition: The number equivalent to the sum of nine and one; one more than nine.
words.notes: The number **10**.
examples: The class has **ten** students.
The meeting will start in **ten** minutes.

words.definition: A sport in which two or four players use rackets to hit a ball back and forth over a net.
words.notes: A common sport.
examples: I play **tennis** every weekend.
Do you like watching **tennis** matches?

words.definition: Extremely bad or serious; dreadful.
words.notes: A strong word for very bad.
examples: I have a **terrible** headache.
The weather was **terrible** on our holiday.

words.definition: A procedure intended to establish the quality, performance, or reliability of something; an examination.
words.notes: Can be a **noun** (**sınav**) or a **verb** (**sınamak**).
examples: I have a math **test** tomorrow.
We need to **test** the new system.

words.definition: A book or other written or printed work; a short message sent electronically, typically from one mobile phone to another.
words.notes: Can be a **noun** (**metin, mesaj**) or a **verb** (**mesaj atmak**).
examples: The book contains a lot of interesting **text**.
I will **text** you when I arrive.

words.definition: Used to introduce the second element in a comparison.
words.notes: A conjunction used for **comparison**.
examples: She is taller **than** her brother.
This car is more expensive **than** that one.

words.definition: To express gratitude to (someone).
words.notes: The noun form is **thanks**.
examples: I **thank** you for your help.
I should **thank** him for the gift.

words.definition: A polite expression used when acknowledging a gift, service, or compliment.
words.notes: The noun form of **thank** (always plural).
examples: **Thanks** for the coffee!
Many **thanks** for your kind words.

words.definition: Used to refer to a specific thing observed or heard, especially one further away from the speaker.
words.notes: The singular demonstrative pronoun/determiner. Opposite of **this**.
examples: Look at **that** house.
**That** is a good idea.

words.definition: Used to refer to specific nouns that are known or have already been mentioned.
words.notes: The most common word in English; the definite article.
examples: **The** sun is bright.
Pass me **the** book on **the** table.

words.definition: A building or outdoor area in which plays and other dramatic performances are given.
words.notes: Spelled 'theater' in American English. Used for live performances.
examples: We are going to the **theatre** tonight.
The new play at the **theatre** is popular.

words.definition: Belonging to or associated with the people or things previously mentioned or easily identified.
words.notes: The third person plural possessive determiner.
examples: That is **their** car.
They live with **their** parents.

words.definition: Used as the object of a verb or preposition to refer to two or more people or things previously mentioned or easily identified.
words.notes: The third person plural object pronoun.
examples: I saw **them** at the park.
Give the keys to **them**.

words.translation: o zamanlar, o zamanki, o zamanın
words.definition: At that time; after that; next.
words.notes: Used to indicate a sequence of events in time.
examples: I finished my work and **then** went home.
I was in high school **then**.

words.definition: In or at that place; used to introduce a noun or verb.
words.notes: The opposite is **here**.
examples: Look over **there**.
**There** are five books on the table.
We went **there** yesterday.

words.definition: Used to refer to two or more people or things previously mentioned or easily identified.
words.notes: The third person plural subject pronoun.
examples: **They** are going to the cinema.
Where are the keys? **They** are on the desk.

words.definition: An inanimate object; an unspecified object, action, or event.
words.notes: A very general noun.
examples: What is that **thing** on the floor?
I have a few **things** to do today.

words.definition: To have a particular opinion, belief, or idea; to use one's mind to consider something.
words.notes: **Irregular verb**: think - thought - thought. Used for opinions and ideas.
examples: What do you **think** about this plan?
I **think** it's going to rain.

words.definition: Constituting number three in a sequence; one of three equal parts of a whole.
words.notes: The ordinal number **3rd**.
examples: Today is the **third** of March.
She finished **third** in the race.

words.definition: Feeling a need to drink.
words.notes: Used in the phrase **I am thirsty**.
examples: I am very **thirsty** after running.
Do you want a drink? You look **thirsty**.

words.definition: The number equivalent to the sum of ten and three; one more than twelve.
words.notes: The number **13**.
examples: There are **thirteen** people in the car.
The party is at **thirteen** hundred hours (1 pm).

words.definition: The number equivalent to the product of ten and three; ten less than forty.
words.notes: The number **30**.
examples: She is **thirty** years old.
There are **thirty** days in April.

words.definition: Used to refer to a specific thing observed or heard, especially one closer to the speaker.
words.notes: The singular demonstrative pronoun/determiner. Opposite of **that**.
examples: **This** is my book.
I like **this** color better.

words.definition: The number equivalent to the product of a hundred and ten; 1,000.
words.notes: The number **1,000**.
examples: The city has one **thousand** inhabitants.
The car cost ten **thousand** dollars.

words.definition: The number equivalent to the sum of two and one; one more than two.
words.notes: The number **3**.
examples: I have **three** cats.
The meeting lasted **three** hours.

words.definition: Moving in one side and out of the other side of (an opening, channel, or location).
words.notes: Used as a preposition or adverb to indicate movement or completion.
examples: The train went **through** the tunnel.
We drove **through** the city.
I read the book all the way **through**.

words.definition: The day of the week before Friday and following Wednesday.
words.notes: Used when talking about days of the week.
examples: I have a meeting every **Thursday**.
See you next **Thursday**.

words.definition: A piece of paper or card that gives the holder a specified right, especially to enter a place or to travel on a public transport system.
words.notes: Used for entry or travel.
examples: I bought a cinema **ticket**.
Do you have your train **ticket**?

words.definition: The indefinite continued progress of existence and events in the past, present, and future; a moment or period in which an action, process, or condition exists or continues.
words.notes: A very common abstract noun. Can be countable (**kez, kere**) or uncountable (**müddet**).
examples: What **time** is it?
I don't have much **time**.
I visited that city three **times**.

words.definition: Feeling a need to rest or sleep; exhausted.
words.notes: Used in the phrase **I am tired**. The opposite is **energetic**.
examples: I was **tired** after a long day of work.
I feel too **tired** to go out.

words.definition: The name of a book, composition, or other artistic work; a word or phrase that describes a person's rank or status.
words.notes: Used for names of works (başlık) or status (unvan).
examples: What is the **title** of the film?
The book's **title** is very interesting.

words.definition: Expressing motion in the direction of (a place, person, or thing); used with the base form of a verb to form the infinitive.
words.notes: A very common preposition and the infinitive marker.
examples: I am going **to** the park.
I want **to** learn English.

words.definition: On this current day.
words.notes: Used as an adverb or a noun. The opposite is **yesterday**.
examples: I have a lot of work **today**.
**Today** is Tuesday.

words.definition: With or in proximity to another person or people; simultaneously.
words.notes: The opposite is **separately**.
examples: We will go to the party **together**.
Let's work on this project **together**.

words.definition: A ceramic bowl with a hinged seat and a device for flushing, used for defecation and urination; the room containing this bowl.
words.notes: Used to refer to the fixture or the room.
examples: Where is the **toilet**, please?
I need to clean the **toilet**.

words.definition: A soft, typically red or yellow, pulpy fruit eaten as a vegetable.
words.notes: A very common fruit used in cooking (domates).
examples: I put sliced **tomato** on my sandwich.
We are growing **tomatoes** in the garden.

words.definition: On the day after today.
words.notes: Used as an adverb or a noun. The opposite is **yesterday**.
examples: I will see you **tomorrow**.
**Tomorrow** is Friday.

words.definition: On the evening of the present day.
words.notes: Used as an adverb or a noun.
examples: I am going to the cinema **tonight**.
What are you doing **tonight**?

words.definition: In addition; also; to a higher degree than is desirable, permissible, or possible.
words.notes: Used to mean **also** (sona gelir) or **excessively** (sıfattan önce gelir).
examples: I like coffee, **too**.
It is **too** hot to go outside.
The price is **too** expensive.

words.definition: Each of a set of hard, bony structures in the jaws of vertebrates, used for biting and chewing.
words.notes: The plural is **teeth** (**irregular**).
examples: I need to brush my **teeth**.
She lost a baby **tooth**.

words.definition: A subject that someone writes or talks about; a subject for discussion or conversation.
words.notes: Used in educational or discussion contexts.
examples: The main **topic** of the lesson is grammar.
Let's choose a new **topic** for our meeting.

words.definition: A person who is travelling or visiting a place for pleasure.
words.notes: Used when referring to visitors or travelers.
examples: The city is full of **tourists** in the summer.
I saw a group of **tourists** taking photos.

words.definition: An area of human settlement that is smaller than a city but larger than a village.
words.notes: Smaller than a **city**.
examples: I grew up in a small **town**.
We went into **town** to do some shopping.

words.definition: Vehicles moving on a road or public highway.
words.notes: Generally an **uncountable** noun.
examples: The **traffic** is very bad this morning.
There was a lot of **traffic** on the road.

words.definition: A long, connected series of railway carriages or cars; to teach (a person or animal) a particular skill or type of behavior.
words.notes: Can be a **noun** (**tren**) or a **verb** (**eğitmek**).
examples: I take the **train** to work.
She is **training** to be a doctor.

words.definition: To go from one place to another, typically over a distance of some length.
words.notes: Can be a **verb** (**seyahat etmek**) or a **noun** (**seyahat**).
examples: I love to **travel** to new countries.
She is planning to **travel** abroad.

words.definition: A woody perennial plant, typically having a single main stem or trunk growing to a considerable height and bearing lateral branches at some distance from the ground.
words.notes: A large plant.
examples: The bird is sitting in the **tree**.
We planted a small apple **tree**.

words.definition: A journey or excursion, especially for pleasure.
words.notes: Synonym of **journey** or **vacation**.
examples: We went on a day **trip** to the beach.
How was your business **trip**?

words.definition: An outer garment covering the body from the waist to the ankles, with a separate section for each leg.
words.notes: Always used in the **plural** (a pair of trousers). Called 'pants' in American English.
examples: I bought a new pair of **trousers**.
He wore a shirt and dark **trousers**.

words.definition: In accordance with fact or reality; accurate or exact.
words.notes: The opposite is **FALSE**.
examples: The statement is **true**.
It is **true** that he lives here.
I only tell the **truth** (noun).

words.definition: To attempt or endeavor to do something; to sample or test.
words.notes: Used when attempting something or sampling food.
examples: I will **try** my best to finish on time.
**Try** this new type of coffee.

words.definition: A short-sleeved casual top, generally without a collar.
words.notes: A common piece of clothing.
examples: I wear a **T-shirt** when it's hot.
He is wearing a blue **T-shirt**.

words.definition: To stay in a state of expectation; delay until a particular time or event.
words.notes: Often used with 'for' (wait for the bus).
examples: Please **wait** here for me.
I can't **wait** to see the movie.

words.definition: A man whose job is to serve customers at their tables in a restaurant.
words.notes: The female equivalent is **waitress**.
examples: The **waiter** brought us the menu.
We tipped the **waiter** after the meal.

words.definition: To emerge or cause to emerge from a state of sleep.
words.notes: **Irregular verb**: wake - woke - woken. Often used with 'up' (wake up).
examples: I **wake** up at seven in the morning.
Don't **wake** the baby.

words.definition: To move at a regular pace by lifting and setting down each foot in turn, never having both feet off the ground at once.
words.notes: Can be a **verb** or a **noun** (yürüyüş).
examples: I **walk** to the park every day.
Let's go for a **walk**.

words.definition: A continuous vertical structure, usually made of stone or brick, that forms a side of a building or room.
words.notes: Used for the sides of buildings or rooms.
examples: The picture is hanging on the **wall**.
The garden has a stone **wall** around it.

words.definition: To have a desire to possess or do (something); wish for.
words.notes: Used to express desire or need.
examples: I **want** a new job.
Do you **want** to go out tonight?

words.definition: Having or giving out a moderate degree of heat; relatively high temperature.
words.notes: The opposite is **cold**.
examples: I put on a **warm** jacket.
The weather is **warm** today.

words.definition: To clean with water and, typically, soap or detergent.
words.notes: Used for cleaning clothes, dishes, or oneself.
examples: Please **wash** your hands before dinner.
I need to **wash** my car.

words.definition: To look at or observe attentively over a period of time; a small timepiece worn on the wrist.
words.notes: Can be a **verb** (**izlemek**) or a **noun** (**saat**).
examples: I **watch** TV in the evening.
What time is it on your **watch**?

words.definition: A colorless, transparent, odorless liquid that forms the seas, lakes, rivers, and rain and is the basis of the fluids of living organisms.
words.notes: A basic necessity. Generally an **uncountable** noun.
examples: I need a glass of **water**.
The plants need **water**.

words.definition: A method, plan, or means of achieving something; a direction or route.
words.notes: Used for roads, directions, or methods (tarz).
examples: What is the best **way** to learn English?
Do you know the **way** to the station?

words.definition: Used by a speaker to refer to himself or herself and one or more other people considered together.
words.notes: The first person plural **subject pronoun**.
examples: **We** are going to the party.
**We** live in the same city.

words.definition: To have (clothing or an accessory) on one's body.
words.notes: **Irregular verb**: wear - wore - worn. Used for clothes, jewelry, etc.
examples: I **wear** glasses for reading.
She is **wearing** a red dress.

words.definition: The state of the atmosphere at a particular place and time as regards heat, cloudiness, dryness, sunshine, wind, rain, etc.
words.notes: Used when talking about atmospheric conditions.
examples: What is the **weather** like today?
The **weather** is very cold in winter.

words.definition: A set of related web pages under a single domain name.
words.notes: A location on the World Wide Web.
examples: I visited a useful **website** for learning.
What is the address of your **website**?

words.definition: The day of the week before Thursday and following Tuesday.
words.notes: The middle day of the typical working week.
examples: I have a doctor's appointment this **Wednesday**.
See you on **Wednesday** morning.

words.definition: A period of seven days.
words.notes: Used when talking about periods of time.
examples: I work five days a **week**.
I'm going on holiday next **week**.

words.definition: Saturday and Sunday.
words.notes: Used in the phrase **on the weekend** or **at the weekend**.
examples: What are your plans for the **weekend**?
I like to relax on the **weekend**.

words.translation: hoş geldiniz, hoş geldin, hoş karşılamak
words.definition: Used as a greeting to show pleasure at a person's arrival; to receive (someone) in a specified way.
words.notes: Used as a greeting or an expression of gratitude (you're welcome).
examples: **Welcome** to our home!
You are **welcome** to join us.

words.definition: In a satisfactory or good way; in a good or acceptable state.
words.notes: The adverb form of **good**. Used to describe an action.
examples: I speak English quite **well**.
She is doing **well** at school.
I don't feel very **well** (adjective).

words.definition: The direction toward the point of the horizon where the sun sets.
words.notes: One of the four main compass directions. The opposite is **east**.
examples: The sun sets in the **west**.
We traveled **west** for two hours.

words.definition: Asking for information specifying something; used to ask for a choice from an unlimited range.
words.notes: A very common question word (ne).
examples: **What** is your name?
**What** are you doing now?
**What** kind of food do you like?

words.definition: At what time; after which; at the time that.
words.notes: A question word for time (ne zaman) or a conjunction (zaman).
examples: **When** did you arrive?
I was young **when** I met him.

words.definition: In or at what place; to or toward what place.
words.notes: A question word for location (nerede).
examples: **Where** do you live?
The book is **where** I left it.

words.definition: Asking for information specifying one or more people or things from a definite set.
words.notes: A question word for choice from a limited set (hangi).
examples: **Which** color do you prefer, red or blue?
**Which** bus goes to the city center?

words.definition: Of the color of milk or fresh snow; the lightest color, the opposite of black.
words.notes: A primary color.
examples: She wore a **white** dress.
The walls are painted **white**.

words.definition: Asking what or which person or people; used to refer to a person or people just mentioned.
words.notes: A question word for people (kim).
examples: **Who** is that woman?
**Who** are you going with?

words.definition: For what reason or purpose.
words.notes: A question word for reason (neden). Answered with **because**.
examples: **Why** are you sad?
**Why** did you leave early?

words.definition: A married woman, especially in relation to her husband.
words.notes: The female spouse. The male equivalent is **husband**.
examples: His **wife** is a very kind person.
I introduced my **wife** to my friends.

words.definition: Used to express the future tense (gelecek zaman).
words.notes: A modal auxiliary verb. Used to talk about the future, promises, or sudden decisions.
examples: I **will** call you tomorrow.
The sun **will** rise at 6 am.

words.definition: To be successful or victorious in a contest or conflict.
words.notes: **Irregular verb**: win - won - won. The opposite is **lose**.
examples: Which team do you think **will win**?
She **won** the first prize.

words.definition: An opening in the wall or roof of a building or vehicle that is fitted with a frame of glass or other transparent material to admit light or air.
words.notes: Used for the opening in a wall.
examples: Please open the **window**, it's hot.
I looked out of the **window**.

words.definition: An alcoholic drink made from fermented grape juice.
words.notes: Generally an **uncountable** noun.
examples: I prefer red **wine**.
Would you like a glass of **wine**?

words.definition: The coldest season of the year, between autumn and spring.
words.notes: A season of the year. Often used with **in** (e.g., in winter).
examples: It often snows in the **winter**.
**Winter** is my least favorite season.

words.definition: Accompanied by (another person or thing); possessing (something).
words.notes: A very common preposition (ile).
examples: I went to the cinema **with** my friend.
Do you want coffee **with** milk?
I am staying **with** my parents.

words.definition: In the absence of (someone or something).
words.notes: The opposite is **with**.
examples: I can't live **without** my phone.
He left the house **without** saying goodbye.

words.definition: An adult female human being.
words.notes: The plural is **women** (**irregular**). The opposite is **man**.
examples: She is a beautiful **woman**.
There were three **women** in the room.

words.definition: Inspiring delight, pleasure, or admiration; extremely good.
words.notes: A strong adjective meaning **very good**.
examples: We had a **wonderful** time on holiday.
That's a **wonderful** idea!

words.definition: A single distinct meaningful element of speech or writing, used with others (or sometimes alone) to form a sentence.
words.notes: The basic unit of language.
examples: Can you spell that **word**?
I learned ten new **words** today.

words.definition: Activity involving mental or physical effort done in order to achieve a purpose or result; a job or task.
words.notes: Can be a **verb** (**çalışmak**) or a **noun** (**iş**).
examples: I **work** in an office.
I have a lot of **work** to do.

words.definition: A person who does a specified type of work or who is employed.
words.notes: The person performing the action of **work**.
examples: The factory employs many **workers**.
She is a hard **worker**.

words.definition: The earth, together with all its countries and peoples; the area of human experience and interest.
words.notes: Used to refer to the planet or a specific realm.
examples: The **world** is a beautiful place.
I want to travel the **world**.

words.definition: Used to express the conditional mood; used to express a polite request or wish.
words.notes: A modal auxiliary verb. Used for wishes (**I would like**) and hypothetical situations.
examples: **Would** you like some water?
I **would** travel if I had the money.

words.definition: To mark (letters, words, or other symbols) on a surface, typically paper, with a pen, pencil, or other device.
words.notes: **Irregular verb**: write - wrote - written. The noun is **writing** or **writer**.
examples: I need to **write** an email.
Please **write** your name clearly.

words.definition: A person who has written something or who writes books, stories, or articles as a job.
words.notes: The person performing the action of **write**.
examples: He is a famous science-fiction **writer**.
My favorite **writer** is from Turkey.

words.definition: The act or process of composing or creating a text.
words.notes: The activity itself (gerund).
examples: I practice my **writing** every day.
Her **writing** is easy to read.

words.definition: Not correct or true; incorrect.
words.notes: The opposite is **right** or **correct**.
examples: That answer is **wrong**.
What's **wrong** with the computer?

words.definition: Used to express assent or agreement (informal).
words.notes: Informal version of **yes**.
examples: **Yeah**, I think so too.
**Yeah**, let's go.

words.definition: The time taken by the earth to make one revolution around the sun (365 or 366 days).
words.notes: Used for long periods of time.
examples: Happy New **Year**!
I graduated two **years** ago.

words.definition: Of the color between green and orange in the spectrum, a primary color that makes green when mixed with blue and red when mixed with orange.
words.notes: A primary color.
examples: The sun is **yellow**.
I bought a **yellow** dress.

words.definition: Used to give an affirmative response.
words.notes: The opposite is **no**.
examples: **Yes**, I would like some coffee.
Did you finish the work? **Yes**.

words.definition: On the day before today.
words.notes: The opposite is **tomorrow**.
examples: I saw him **yesterday**.
**Yesterday** was a beautiful day.

words.definition: Used to refer to the person or people that the speaker is addressing.
words.notes: The second person singular or plural pronoun (subject or object).
examples: **You** are a good student.
Can I help **you**?

words.definition: Having lived or existed for only a short time.
words.notes: The opposite is **old**.
examples: She is a **young** girl.
He looks **young** for his age.

words.definition: Belonging to or associated with the person or people that the speaker is addressing.
words.notes: The second person possessive determiner.
examples: Is this **your** bag?
**Your** English is very good.

words.definition: Used as the object of a verb or preposition to refer to the person being addressed.
words.notes: The second person singular reflexive pronoun.
examples: Be careful with the knife, don't hurt **yourself**.
Did you enjoy **yourself** at the party?

words.definition: The day of the week before Wednesday and following Monday.
words.notes: Used when talking about days of the week.
examples: I have a class every **Tuesday**.
The meeting is next **Tuesday**.

words.definition: To move in a circular direction around an axis or center; to change direction.
words.notes: Can be a **verb** (**dönmek**) or a **noun** (**dönüş**). Used in the phrase **turn left/right**.
examples: **Turn** off the light before you leave.
The car **turned** the corner.
It's your **turn** to play.

words.definition: An abbreviation for **television**; the apparatus used for receiving broadcast images and sound.
words.notes: The common abbreviation for television.
examples: I like watching **TV** in the evening.
Is there anything good on **TV** tonight?

words.definition: The number equivalent to the sum of ten and two; one more than eleven.
words.notes: The number **12**.
examples: There are **twelve** months in a year.
The clock struck **twelve** o'clock.

words.definition: The number equivalent to the product of two and ten; ten more than ten.
words.notes: The number **20**.
examples: I bought **twenty** apples.
He is **twenty** years old.

words.translation: iki kez, iki sefer, iki kere
words.definition: On two occasions; two times.
words.notes: Used as an adverb of frequency. Synonym of 'two times'.
examples: I visited that museum **twice**.
She called me **twice** this morning.

words.definition: The number equivalent to the sum of one and one; one more than one.
words.notes: The number **2**.
examples: I have **two** brothers.
The movie lasts **two** hours.

words.definition: A category of people or things having common characteristics; to write something using a keyboard.
words.notes: Can be a **noun** (**tür**) or a **verb** (**yazmak**).
examples: What **type** of music do you like?
I need to **type** this letter quickly.

words.definition: A device consisting of a circular canopy of cloth on a folding frame, used for protection against rain or sun.
words.notes: Used for protection from rain.
examples: Don't forget your **umbrella**, it's raining.
I left my **umbrella** at home.

words.definition: The brother of one's father or mother or the husband of one's aunt.
words.notes: Used for a male relative of the generation above.
examples: My **uncle** lives in Ankara.
We visited my **uncle** and aunt.

words.definition: Extending or moving below the surface of (something); below, beneath, or covered by (something).
words.notes: The opposite is **over** or **above**.
examples: The book is **under** the table.
I found my keys **under** the sofa.

words.definition: To perceive the intended meaning of (words, a language, or a speaker); to grasp the significance, explanation, or cause of (something).
words.notes: **Irregular verb**: understand - understood - understood.
examples: I don't **understand** this word.
Do you **understand** what I mean?

words.definition: An institution of higher education and research, granting academic degrees in various subjects.
words.notes: Used for higher education. Often shortened to **uni**.
examples: I study history at the **university**.
She is going to **university** next year.

words.definition: Up to (the point in time or the event mentioned).
words.notes: Used to show a finishing point in time or an event.
examples: I waited **until** 6 pm.
I will stay here **until** you return.

words.definition: Toward a higher place; used to indicate movement to a higher level.
words.notes: The opposite is **down**.
examples: He climbed **up** the ladder.
The price of gas went **up**.

words.definition: On or to an upper floor of a building.
words.notes: The opposite is **downstairs**.
examples: My bedroom is **upstairs**.
I'm going **upstairs** to read a book.

words.definition: Used as the object of a verb or preposition to refer to the speaker and one or more other people considered together.
words.notes: The first person plural **object pronoun**.
examples: Give the map to **us**.
Can you help **us** with this problem?

words.definition: To employ (something) for a purpose; the action of employing something.
words.notes: Can be a **verb** (**kullanmak**) or a **noun** (**kullanım**).
examples: I **use** my computer for work.
Can I make **use** of your phone?

words.definition: Able to be used for a practical purpose or in several ways.
words.notes: The opposite is **useless**.
examples: This dictionary is very **useful**.
I learned many **useful** phrases.

words.definition: Under normal conditions; generally.
words.notes: An adverb of frequency. Synonym of **generally**.
examples: I **usually** drink coffee in the morning.
We **usually** go on holiday in the summer.

words.definition: An extended period of leisure and recreation, especially one spent away from home or in traveling.
words.notes: American English term. Synonym of **holiday** (UK).
examples: I'm planning a **vacation** to Spain.
We went on a short **vacation** to the mountains.

words.definition: A plant or part of a plant used as food, typically served as an accompaniment to meat or fish.
words.notes: Used when talking about healthy food.
examples: I eat a lot of fresh **vegetables**.
What is your favorite **vegetable**?

words.definition: In a high degree; extremely.
words.notes: Used to intensify adjectives and adverbs.
examples: I am **very** happy to see you.
The book is **very** interesting.

words.definition: A recording of moving visual images made digitally or on videotape.
words.notes: Used for digital recordings of movement and sound.
examples: I watched a funny **video** online.
Did you take a **video** of the concert?

words.definition: A cluster of houses in a rural area, of size smaller than a town.
words.notes: Smaller than a **town**.
examples: He grew up in a small **village**.
The **village** is located in the mountains.

words.definition: To go to see someone or somewhere as a guest or tourist.
words.notes: Can be a **verb** (**ziyaret etmek**) or a **noun** (**ziyaret**).
examples: I will **visit** my aunt next week.
We went for a short **visit** to the museum.

words.definition: A person visiting a person or place.
words.notes: The person who is **visiting**.
examples: The museum gets many **visitors** in the summer.
We have a **visitor** coming to stay with us.
